Brooks"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035761/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029125/","name":"Mark Andrus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000985/","name":"James L. Brooks"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"As Good As It Gets","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2948006169","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTdmZTQxMDEtZjNjMy00OTAxLWExNjQtODI1ZThjZTAwNzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTdmZTQxMDEtZjNjMy00OTAxLWExNjQtODI1ZThjZTAwNzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"datePublished":"1997-12-25","description":"A single mother and waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery.","keywords":"obsessive compulsive disorder,unlikely friendship,friendship,writer,neighbor","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ODDBear"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Simply great","reviewBody":"As Good As It Gets is one of those incredibly moving films that is also hugely entertaining. It's not just a comedy, you can't quite label it a drama piece, it just is what it is; simply great.

What works here so well are the actors and the script. Nicholson and Hunt both won Oscars and they're simply great but Kinnear is no less effective as Nicholson gay neighbour. Plus that dog is amazing as well. This film really relies on great performances and there's no shortage of that here.

As Good As It Gets is also remarkably well written. So well defined characters and completely involving, you quite simply grow to love them and sympathize with their plight. Nicholson's remarks are terrific, each one very quotable (personal fav; I think of a man and I take away reason and accountability).

Direction is first rate, Brooks made Terms of Endearment so it's well established that he's quite capable of making great films. As Good As It Gets is very nearly as good it gets.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":281445,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 7 Days in Hell
Nie ma jak w piekle
programme.desc:
7 Days in Hell: Directed by Jake Szymanski. With Andy Samberg, Kit Harington, Fred Armisen, David Copperfield. A fictional documentary-style expose on the rivalry between two of the greatest tennis players of all-time who battled it out in a 2001 match that lasted seven days." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3895884/","name":"7 Days in Hell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTE0NzM5OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwMDc1NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fictional documentary-style expose on the rivalry between two of the greatest tennis players of all-time who battled it out in a 2001 match that lasted seven days.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3895884/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peefyn"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Comedians having fun","reviewBody":"I must assume that this started as an idea for a skit, but they kept adding on jokes until they realized that they couldn't go any further. At a bit over 40 minutes, this skit is just about as long as it could be. And they cram those 40 minutes full of gags. And all the people involved seems like they are having a great time.

I laughed at many parts of this, as crazy/over-the-top comedy often can be quite funny, especially delivered in a dead pan way. I wish they would have gone further in getting the actor's to play it straight. Kit Harington does a great job, not acknowledging (with his acting) that he is playing in a comedy. Many of the other people appearing in the movie are almost winking at the camera.

The scenes in Swedish are quite fun, as the Swedish actor actually says his lines in Swedish, while Samberg channels the Swedish chef from the muppets show.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17598,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Comedy","Sport"],"datePublished":"2015-07-11","keywords":"tennis player,tennis,male pubic hair,pubic hair,streaker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"7 Days in Hell: "Eternal Flames" Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi742240281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2MTI2ODgzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc5NzA5NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2MTI2ODgzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc5NzA5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"First teaser for HBO's fictional documentary, 7 Days in Hell."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676221/","name":"Andy Samberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3229685/","name":"Kit Harington"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035488/","name":"Fred Armisen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021516/","name":"Jake Szymanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0563019/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1104505/","name":"Murray Miller"}],"duration":"PT43M"}</script><metacontent="

Szalony lot
programme.desc: Flight of Fury: Directed by Michael Keusch. With Steven Seagal, Steve Toussaint, Angus MacInnes, Mark Bazeley. John is sent in to recover a stolen Stealth Bomber. His trusty sidekick Rojar and ever faithful Jessica fight the rebel forces of Banansistan, led by the vivacious Ellianna." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0783518/","name":"Flight of Fury","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyMTU3ODIyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQ3NjAwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"John is sent in to recover a stolen Stealth Bomber. His trusty sidekick Rojar and ever faithful Jessica fight the rebel forces of Banansistan, led by the vivacious Ellianna.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0783518/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MrOllie"},"dateCreated":"2012-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"I thought it was OK!","reviewBody":"If you can ignore the usual faults with Seagal movies then this is an OK action flick. In this one Steve is a fighter pilot and the only man who can recapture s stolen US Stealth aircraft. The aeroplane action scenes where better than I expected them to be after reading some of the reviews of this film, and the acting was I thought OK. There is not so much hand to hand fight scenes in this film as in other Seagal movies which might disappoint some Seagal fans,however, we do have a lesbian scene midway through the film with Steve lurking in the background looking a little like a seedy voyeur. Steve does tend to mumble his lines at times so we are not sure what he has said, but still most Seagal fans should find this a decent movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3995,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2007-02-20","keywords":"pilot,terrorist,bomber,street shootout,m 16","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Flight of Fury","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2913403161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2NkNThjZmItYmJmNy00NDAyLTg4MDctNWZmOTRjM2UwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2NkNThjZmItYmJmNy00NDAyLTg4MDctNWZmOTRjM2UwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000219/","name":"Steven Seagal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063303/","name":"Mark Bazeley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869750/","name":"Steve Toussaint"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0450661/","name":"Michael Keusch"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020879/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003653/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000219/","name":"Steven Seagal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1546172/","name":"Joe Halpin"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

Steve does tend to mumble his lines at times so we are not sure what he has said, but still most Seagal fans should find this a decent movie.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3995,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2007-02-20","keywords":"pilot,terrorist,bomber,street shootout,m 16","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Flight of Fury","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2913403161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2NkNThjZmItYmJmNy00NDAyLTg4MDctNWZmOTRjM2UwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2NkNThjZmItYmJmNy00NDAyLTg4MDctNWZmOTRjM2UwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000219/","name":"Steven Seagal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063303/","name":"Mark Bazeley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869750/","name":"Steve Toussaint"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0450661/","name":"Michael Keusch"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020879/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003653/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000219/","name":"Steven Seagal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1546172/","name":"Joe Halpin"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Eat Pray Love
Jedz, módl się, kochaj
programme.desc:
Eat Pray Love: Directed by Ryan Murphy. With Julia Roberts, I. Gusti Ayu Puspawati, Hadi Subiyanto, Billy Crudup. A married woman realizes how unhappy her marriage really is, and that her life needs to go in a different direction. After a painful divorce, she takes off on a round-the-world journey to "find herself"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0879870/","name":"Eat Pray Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NDkyNzkyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDQyNDk0Mw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000849/","name":"Javier Bardem"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0420955/","name":"Richard Jenkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614682/","name":"Ryan Murphy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136967/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0087432/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614682/","name":"Ryan Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0759022/","name":"Jennifer Salt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2418691/","name":"Elizabeth Gilbert"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eat Pray Love: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2996176409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTU5MTczNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk0NTM2Mw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTU5MTczNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk0NTM2Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Happily married Elizabeth Gilbert (Roberts) takes a right turn in her life by enduring a painful divorce and proceeding to take a round-the-world journey of self-enlightenment and fulfillment. "},"datePublished":"2010-08-13","description":"A married woman realizes how unhappy her marriage really is, and that her life needs to go in a different direction. After a painful divorce, she takes off on a round-the-world journey to "find herself".","keywords":"emotional balance,indonesia,inner peace,traveling,young woman","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0879870/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ja-br-sa"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crucial point in the story left out in the movie","reviewBody":"Altogether, the topic, the locations, the atmospheres, the acting made me enjoy the movie more than the book. I read the book and found it OK, but not like fantastic (almost like the Alchymist by Coehlo; sort of simple enough for anyone to understand, but deep enough for a lot of people to feel intellectual or in touch with new thoughts). But for the movie I had low expectations, based on the reviews - nonetheless I was positively surprised, though left wondering if most critics are just a bunch of sheep following a path (made by an old sheep who left decades ago)? And hence, obliged to hate any woman prioritizing herself?

The movie deals with a topic that very few (American) movies actually deal with - our inner lives and pursuits for balance and happiness. Maybe because it is difficult, as it is a somewhat stand still, internal journey. But EPL has made it possible by wrapping it into an external journey too. 

But my main point adding to the other reviews: Some of the criticism of the movie is that the main character doesn't seem to have a good reason to be unhappy, and to leave her husband. However, what is dealt with in the book, but not comes across in the movie, is that she and her husband are to trying to have a baby, as is expected by "people" (and by her husband). EG discovers in this process that she is still not ready for children, in fact she never will be. She doesn't feel cut for it at all, and if she has a child, she feel she'll lose herself (her new husband got himself fixed before he met her, so there was never a question about it). To choose away what many women view as a deed to validate their existence; having children, is tough and scary. One will be judged. Also, she knew her husband's expectation of building a family was not unreasonable, making her feel ashamed and different. This is one of the key reasons for her to start praying; to be able to follow her own instincts, breaking the conventional norms. By excluding from the script this realization for the main character, the viewer is left puzzled with what is wrong in this marriage, there is something that doesn't make sense here. Too bad, leaving this issue out, as it would've added another dimension to the movie and increase the viewers understanding of why EG and her husband should split.

I can't help wonder why they chose to eliminate it from the story, whether it is because it would not appeal to conservative American women who after all are the majority of the box office customers for this movie? Or whether the movie creator thought it wouldn't make a difference? After all it made the whole lot of difference to the marriage, and was a impetus for her entire journey.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":91310,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

She looks like a little girl who needs a doll, but she's very smart and","keywords":"21st century,police,paris france,france","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1418572/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"terencecarson","dateCreated":"2015-07-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Profiling the french way","reviewBody":"This show centers on the character of criminologist Chloé Saint-Laurent, a young woman whose expertise and unorthodox methods help to solve police cases in Paris. While for the rest we have a standard french police series with the usual amount of crimes and personal life of the police unit members, what makes it unique it's her: goofy, bold, reasoning, she gets the job done her way. I don't think you can remain indifferent to the character: either you like her or not (personally I adore). She earned a place in the long list of eccentric people started, I believe, by Dr. House. The role is played by Odile Vuillemin. Update: season 7 sees the departure of Chloé, substituted by a new profiler, Adèle Delettre, a recurring character in the show. Her approach is very different from Saint-Laurent's and the series takes a more dramatic tone. A bit of sense of humour is missing so I'd give 7/10 to this new "profilage".","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1128,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5</script><metacontent="

Step Brothers: Directed by Adam McKay. With Will Ferrell, John C. Reilly, Mary Steenburgen, Richard Jenkins. Two aimless middle-aged losers still living at home are forced against their will to become roommates when their parents marry." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0838283/","name":"Step Brothers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODViZDg3ZjYtMzhiYS00YTVkLTk4MzktYWUxMTlkYjc1NjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two aimless middle-aged losers still living at home are forced against their will to become roommates when their parents marry.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0838283/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Dean_Jenkins"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Extremely Stupid Yet Extremely Funny Comedy Gold!","reviewBody":"I watched step brothers yesterday for the second time after purchasing it on DVD. For me this is always the tough test when it comes to comedy. I watched it at a packed cinema which as you know in itself can make a film ultimately funny without being so. But i have to say this film still delivered the goods so well.

First up this film is STUPID it is ridiculous but it's a comedy with Will Ferrell in it what did you honestly expect?! But my god it's funny it really is hilarious Ferrell and Reilly make an awesome on screen team and the comedy moments just bounce off one an other , each man just helps make the others role as funny as it could have been. 

It gives you hilarious jokes , stupidly funny scenes , it's one of those comedy's that so so often tries to catch you off guard and every time it absolutely nails it! 

And underneath all the stupidity bonds are formed , compassion is found and what really matters in life is discovered. You almost feel as if you've learnt a little something

It's one of my personal favourite comedy movies and goes up there with some of the greats (Blazing Saddles , Burn After Reading , Superbad , Knocked Up , Anchorman etc.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":277107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-07-25","keywords":"dysfunctional family,sibling rivalry,original story,slacker,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Brothers: Theatrical trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2847015193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for Step Brothers, directed by Adam McKay."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000604/","name":"John C. For me this is always the tough test when it comes to comedy. I watched it at a packed cinema which as you know in itself can make a film ultimately funny without being so. But i have to say this film still delivered the goods so well.

First up this film is STUPID it is ridiculous but it's a comedy with Will Ferrell in it what did you honestly expect?! But my god it's funny it really is hilarious Ferrell and Reilly make an awesome on screen team and the comedy moments just bounce off one an other , each man just helps make the others role as funny as it could have been. 

It gives you hilarious jokes , stupidly funny scenes , it's one of those comedy's that so so often tries to catch you off guard and every time it absolutely nails it! 

And underneath all the stupidity bonds are formed , compassion is found and what really matters in life is discovered. You almost feel as if you've learnt a little something

It's one of my personal favourite comedy movies and goes up there with some of the greats (Blazing Saddles , Burn After Reading , Superbad , Knocked Up , Anchorman etc.)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":277107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-07-25","keywords":"dysfunctional family,sibling rivalry,original story,slacker,friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Brothers: Theatrical trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2847015193","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for Step Brothers, directed by Adam McKay.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000604/","name":"John C. programme.title: Step Brothers
Bracia przyrodni
programme.desc:
Step Brothers: Directed by Adam McKay. With Will Ferrell, John C. Reilly, Mary Steenburgen, Richard Jenkins. Two aimless middle-aged losers still living at home are forced against their will to become roommates when their parents marry." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0838283/","name":"Step Brothers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODViZDg3ZjYtMzhiYS00YTVkLTk4MzktYWUxMTlkYjc1NjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two aimless middle-aged losers still living at home are forced against their will to become roommates when their parents marry.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0838283/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Dean_Jenkins"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Extremely Stupid Yet Extremely Funny Comedy Gold!","reviewBody":"I watched step brothers yesterday for the second time after purchasing it on DVD. For me this is always the tough test when it comes to comedy. I watched it at a packed cinema which as you know in itself can make a film ultimately funny without being so. But i have to say this film still delivered the goods so well.

First up this film is STUPID it is ridiculous but it's a comedy with Will Ferrell in it what did you honestly expect?! But my god it's funny it really is hilarious Ferrell and Reilly make an awesome on screen team and the comedy moments just bounce off one an other , each man just helps make the others role as funny as it could have been. 

It gives you hilarious jokes , stupidly funny scenes , it's one of those comedy's that so so often tries to catch you off guard and every time it absolutely nails it! 

And underneath all the stupidity bonds are formed , compassion is found and what really matters in life is discovered. You almost feel as if you've learnt a little something

It's one of my personal favourite comedy movies and goes up there with some of the greats (Blazing Saddles , Burn After Reading , Superbad , Knocked Up , Anchorman etc.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":277107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-07-25","keywords":"dysfunctional family,sibling rivalry,original story,slacker,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Brothers: Theatrical trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2847015193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for Step Brothers, directed by Adam McKay."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000604/","name":"John C. Reilly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005460/","name":"Mary Steenburgen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0570912/","name":"Adam McKay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0570912/","name":"Adam McKay"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000604/","name":"John C. For me this is always the tough test when it comes to comedy. I watched it at a packed cinema which as you know in itself can make a film ultimately funny without being so. But i have to say this film still delivered the goods so well.

First up this film is STUPID it is ridiculous but it's a comedy with Will Ferrell in it what did you honestly expect?! But my god it's funny it really is hilarious Ferrell and Reilly make an awesome on screen team and the comedy moments just bounce off one an other , each man just helps make the others role as funny as it could have been. 

It gives you hilarious jokes , stupidly funny scenes , it's one of those comedy's that so so often tries to catch you off guard and every time it absolutely nails it! 

And underneath all the stupidity bonds are formed , compassion is found and what really matters in life is discovered. You almost feel as if you've learnt a little something

It's one of my personal favourite comedy movies and goes up there with some of the greats (Blazing Saddles , Burn After Reading , Superbad , Knocked Up , Anchorman etc.)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":277107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-07-25","keywords":"dysfunctional family,sibling rivalry,original story,slacker,friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Brothers: Theatrical trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2847015193","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDU1NzcwMDkyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE5OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for Step Brothers, directed by Adam McKay.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000604/","name":"John C. Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000601/","name":"Harold Ramis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001548/","name":"Rick Moranis"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"30th Anniversary Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2800593945","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxNTM3MDUxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDgwMDgxMjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxNTM3MDUxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDgwMDgxMjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the 30th Anniversary Trailer for Ghostbusters."},"datePublished":"1984-06-08","description":"Three former parapsychology professors set up shop as a unique ghost removal service.","keywords":"ghost,ghostbuster,university,scientist,paranormal investigation team","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087332/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SmileysWorld"},"dateCreated":"2002-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great marriage of comedy and spookiness","reviewBody":"Very rarely can you pull off a successful blend of two separate movie genres,but the makers of Ghostbusters were overwhelmingly so.On the one hand,you have the comedic charm of Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd,and on the other,a genuine ghostly spookiness that makes you want to hide under a blanket.I recently bought a copy and watched it for the first time in several years,and it's still just as fresh as it was in it's initial release in 1984.It has a great supporting cast for Murray and Aykroyd,including the always great Sigourney Weaver,Rick Moranis,Ernie Hudson,and Harold Ramis,who is just as talented behind the camera as he is in front of it.Watch it with your family,but keep an eye on younger children,as the spookiness may be more than they can handle. Great stuff.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":363604,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

the 30th Anniversary Trailer for Ghostbusters."},"datePublished":"1984-06-08","description":"Three former parapsychology professors set up shop as a unique ghost removal team","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087332/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SmileysWorld"},"dateCreated":"2002-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great marriage of comedy and spookiness","reviewBody":"Very rarely can you pull off a successful blend of two separate movie genres,but the makers of Ghostbusters were overwhelmingly so.On the one hand,you have the comedic charm of Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd,and on the other,a genuine ghostly spookiness that makes you want to hide under a blanket.I recently bought a copy and watched it for the first time in several years,and it's still just as fresh as it was in it's initial release in 1984.It has a great supporting cast for Murray and Aykroyd,including the always great Sigourney Weaver,Rick Moranis,Ernie Hudson,and Harold Ramis,who is just as talented behind the camera as he is in front of it.Watch it with your family,but keep an eye on younger children,as the spookiness may be more than they can handle. Great stuff.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":363604,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

marriage of comedy and spookiness","reviewBody":"Very rarely can you pull off a successful blend of two separate movie genres,but the makers of Ghostbusters were overwhelmingly so.On the one hand,you have the comedic charm of Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd,and on the other,a genuine ghostly spookiness that makes you want to hide under a blanket.I recently bought a copy and watched it for the first time in several years,and it's still just as fresh as it was in it's initial release in 1984.It has a great supporting cast for Murray and Aykroyd,including the always great Sigourney Weaver,Rick Moranis,Ernie Hudson,and Harold Ramis,who is just as talented behind the camera as he is in front of it.Watch it with your family,but keep an eye on younger children,as the spookiness may be more than they can handle. programme.title: Ma famille et le loup
Chłopiec i wilk
programme.desc:
Ma famille et le loup: Directed by Adrià García. With Carmen Maura, Pierre Rochefort, Bruno Salomone, Franc Bruneau. 9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5869404/","name":"Ma famille et le loup","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNmVlNTctM2MxYS00MWUyLTg0ZTYtYTg2NDIzMWU0YmNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA1MDczNjc@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0560962/","name":"Carmen Maura"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734004/","name":"Pierre Rochefort"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758912/","name":"Bruno Salomone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2348224/","name":"Adrià García"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0596308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0698042/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0384091/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5526293/","name":"Valérie Magis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1166131/","name":"Stéphane Malandrin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159646/","name":"Víctor Maldonado"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2453519385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2019-08-21","description":"9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure","keywords":"children","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5869404/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The wolf always wins.","reviewBody":"In the children's imaginative world there are the goodies (Santa Claus, the Tooth Fairy) and the baddies ( the Wolf ,the Bogey Man) .The Wolf wins in Charles Perrault' s "the Little Red riding Hood" ,even though the tale was often sweetened when told to children (the hunter's intervention).

Grandma met the Wolf when she was young (a little red riding hood ), but she was saved by the man who would become her husband (the equivalent of the hunter).But this summer ,he comes to take her back,now that she is about to celebrate her eightieth birthday.

Her grandchilden are not prepared to accept it ; instead of bickering ,they will spend their holidays looking for a way to prevent grandma from being "wolfed" .But the old lady had already told Hugo -it was the first time he had met her ,for his dad is a workaholic,often on his mobile - there was no sense in trying for she made a deal when she was young,and now her time has come.In the show they stage , granny appears in the finale -after some ponderous acts- just to say goodbye to all her family to urge them to carry on:we survive through our children and our life is eternal.

The movie adds computer animation for the imaginary scenes; the last ones ,in which the wolf intervenes with real characters,a la "Mary Poppins" , are the most successful.

By and large, nevertheless, acting and directing are not equal to the subject :with the exception of the deeply moving Carmen Maura , the actors overplay : the male cast ,particularly , tries to hog the stage and they are almost unbearable ;besides ,in the bakery , they got an incredible nerve ,not exactly an useful example for the young audience ;poetry which was present in Jean-Claude Brialy 's "Eglantine" (1971) on a similar subject is nowhere to be found.

That said, even though the results are not always satisfying , it was a good way to deal with a harsh subject :the ineluctable .The younger audience will certainly need explanations from their parents after viewing it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H20M"}</script><metacontent="

When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure","keywords":"children","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5869404/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen","dateCreated":"2020-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The wolf always wins.","reviewBody":"In the children's imaginative world there are the goodies (Santa Claus, the Tooth Fairy) and the baddies ( the Wolf ,the Bogey Man) .The Wolf wins in Charles Perrault' s "the Little Red riding Hood" ,even though the tale was often sweetened when told to children (the hunter's intervention).

Grandma met the Wolf when she was young (a little red riding hood ), but she was saved by the man who would become her husband (the equivalent of the hunter).But this summer ,he comes to take her back,now that she is about to celebrate her eightieth birthday.

Her grandchilden are not prepared to accept it ; instead of bickering ,they will spend their holidays looking for a way to prevent grandma from being "wolfed" .But the old lady had already told Hugo -it was the first time he had met her ,for his dad is a workaholic,often on his mobile - there was no sense in trying for she made a deal when she was young,and now her time has come.In the show they stage , granny appears in the finale -after some ponderous acts- just to say goodbye to all her family to urge them to carry on:we survive through our children and our life is eternal.

The movie adds computer animation for the imaginary scenes; the last ones ,in which the wolf intervenes with real characters,a la "Mary Poppins" , are the most successful.

By and large, nevertheless, acting and directing are not equal to the subject :with the exception of the deeply moving Carmen Maura , the actors overplay : the male cast ,particularly , tries to hog the stage and they are almost unbearable ;besides ,in the bakery , they got an incredible nerve ,not exactly an useful example for the young audience ;poetry which was present in Jean-Claude Brialy 's "Eglantine" (1971) on a similar subject is nowhere to be found.

That said, even though the results are not always satisfying , it was a good way to deal with a harsh subject :the ineluctable .The younger audience will certainly need explanations from their parents after viewing it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"duration":"PT1H20M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Piłka nożna: PKO BP Ekstraklasa - mecz: Wisła Kraków - Legia Warszawa
programme.desc: Zarówno Biała Gwiazda, jak i mistrzowie Polski mają w tym sezonie kłopoty ze skutecznością. Dodatkowo zespół z Krakowa, gdy pierwszy straci gola, zaczyna grać nerwowo, co negatywnie odbija się na wyniku meczu. Legioniści spróbują to wykorzystać. Są faworytami tego spotkania. Po raz ostatni przegrali z Wisłą w marcu 2019 roku, kiedy na stadionie przy ulicy Reymonta stracili aż cztery gole, nie strzelając żadnego.

programme.title: Liga+ Extra
programme.desc: Gospodarze programu, Krzysztof Marciniak i Bartosz Gleń, podsumowują ostatnią kolejkę PKO Ekstraklasy. W magazynie nie zabraknie bramek, kontrowersji i rozmów z gośćmi. Przy jego tworzeniu współpracować będą: Daria Kabała-Malarz, Cezary Olbrycht, Filip Surma, Rafał Dębiński i Tomasz Lipiński.

programme.title: Limbo
Limbo
programme.desc:
Limbo: Directed by Ben Sharrock. With Sidse Babett Knudsen, Kenneth Collard, Amir El-Masry, Vikash Bhai. Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9138170/","name":"Limbo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBiMDJkMzAtMTVhYi00NDFkLTliMTYtYTM4M2I1OGZmNDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461746/","name":"Sidse Babett Knudsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171674/","name":"Kenneth Collard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5011084/","name":"Amir El-Masry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5277246/","name":"Ben Sharrock"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0501662/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316150/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5277246/","name":"Ben Sharrock"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2474754073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request."},"datePublished":"2021-07-30","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request.","keywords":"one word title,musician as protagonist,separation from family,musician,scottish island","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9138170/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"it's like a guitar","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Immigration is an important and hot topic these days, and it should be noted that most countries have challenges with people either trying to get in or trying to get out ... and for some, it's both. Writer-director Ben Sharrock offers a unique and creative look at refugees stuck on a nameless remote Scottish island, awaiting word on their UK asylum request.

Omar (Amir El-Masry, Tom Clancy's "Jack Ryan" TV series) has escaped the war in Syria, and we learn much about him from listening in on calls to his mother from the only phone booth on the island. An acclaimed musician in Damascus, Omar lugs around his grandfather's oud ("it's like a guitar"). As proof of his homesickness, the bulky case never leaves his side, nor does he pull the instrument out to play - music is meant for joyous occasions. Omar shares a small house with three other refugees: Farhad (Vikash Bhai) from Afghanistan, Abedi (Kwabena Ansah) from Ghana, and Wasef (Ola Orebiyi) from Nigeria, with the latter two posing as brothers in hopes of improving their odds for asylum.

Omar is a sullen stone-face who absorbs the racist taunts from young locals (they ask if he makes bombs), and stands in contrast to the more outgoing and optimistic (and darn funny) Farhad. Not only does he idolize Freddie Mercury for "teaching" him English, Farhad, with his ever-present cigarette, also captures a chicken and keeps it as a pet. These refugees regularly attend a class entitled "Cultural Awareness 101", meant to acclimate those from varying backgrounds to the local customs and culture. These segments are mined beautifully for comedic effect, while also giving us insight into all those involved. There are also references to Chet Baker, Donnie Osmond, and the TV series, "Friends".

This is a terrific film, as well as an odd one. Many of the shots from cinematographer Nick Cooke are static and sparse in style, and though focused on the individuals, the camera also captures much of the isolation of the island. These visuals are stunning in both their simplicity and relevance. It's a dramedy unafraid to be absurd in a moment, while also being enlightening. At times it has the feel of Wes Anderson without the color palette. We aren't sure what is worse, the weather or the local postal service. Brutal cold envelops the newcomers, while the delivery route of a postal van (and the reactions of the refugees) is a comedic highlight. Even the local market, with its limited spice selection and directions for urination, draws laughter from us.

Despite the comedy, we never lose sight of these folks being stuck in purgatory. Maybe it's not true camaraderie, but they seem to take some comfort in numbers as they wait. Omar is carrying guilt and feelings of inadequacy as he chose to leave while his older brother Nabil (Kais Nashif) remained in Syria to fight in the war. There is a wonderful "scene" that allows Omar to make peace with their contrasting decisions, and it leads him back to playing music. After all, "a musician who doesn't play is dead". The titular term of Limbo often means stuck, and there is also a game of persistence that uses that name, and both definitions work here. We are reminded that regardless of the various cultures, those in the immigration system have their own personal stories and burdens.

Opens in theaters on April 30, 2021.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":879,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 9138170, Title: Limbo, --- Description: Limbo: Directed by Ben Sharrock. With Sidse Babett Knudsen, Kenneth Collard, Amir El-Masry, Vikash Bhai. Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9138170/","name":"Limbo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBiMDJkMzAtMTVhYi00NDFkLTliMTYtYTM4M2I1OGZmNDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461746/","name":"Sidse Babett Knudsen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171674/","name":"Kenneth Collard","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5011084/","name":"Amir El-Masry"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5277246/","name":"Ben Sharrock"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0501662/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316150/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5277246/","name":"Ben Sharrock"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2474754073","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request.","datePublished":"2021-07-30","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request.","keywords":"one word title,musician as protagonist,separation from family,musician,scottish island","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9138170/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6","dateCreated":"2021-04-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"it's like a guitar","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Immigration is an important and hot topic these days, and it should be noted that most countries have challenges with people either trying to get in or trying to get out ... and for some, it's both. Writer-director Ben Sharrock offers a unique and creative look at refugees stuck on a nameless remote Scottish island, awaiting word on their UK asylum request.

Omar (Amir El-Masry, Tom Clancy's "Jack Ryan" TV series) has escaped the war in Syria, and we learn much about him from listening in on calls to his mother from the only phone booth on the island. An acclaimed musician in Damascus, Omar lugs around his grandfather's oud ("it's like a guitar"). As proof of his homesickness, the bulky case never leaves his side, nor does he pull the instrument out to play - music is meant for joyous occasions. Omar shares a small house with three other refugees: Farhad (Vikash Bhai) from Afghanistan, Abedi (Kwabena Ansah) from Ghana, and Wasef (Ola Orebiyi) from Nigeria, with the latter two posing as brothers in hopes of improving their odds for asylum.

Omar is a sullen stone-face who absorbs the racist taunts from young locals (they ask if he makes bombs), and stands in contrast to the more outgoing and optimistic (and darn funny) Farhad. Not only does he idolize Freddie Mercury for "teaching" him English, Farhad, with his ever-present cigarette, also captures a chicken and keeps it as a pet. These refugees regularly attend a class entitled "Cultural Awareness 101", meant to acclimate those from varying backgrounds to the local customs and culture. These segments are mined beautifully for comedic effect, while also giving us insight into all those involved. There are also references to Chet Baker, Donnie Osmond, and the TV series, "Friends".

This is a terrific film, as well as an odd one. Many of the shots from cinematographer Nick Cooke are static and sparse in style, and though focused on the individuals, the camera also captures much of the isolation of the island. These visuals are stunning in both their simplicity and relevance. It's a dramedy unafraid to be absurd in a moment, while also being enlightening. At times it has the feel of Wes Anderson without the color palette. We aren't sure what is worse, the weather or the local postal service. Brutal cold envelops the newcomers, while the delivery route of a postal van (and the reactions of the refugees) is a comedic highlight. Even the local market, with its limited spice selection and directions for urination, draws laughter from us.

Despite the comedy, we never lose sight of these folks being stuck in purgatory. Maybe it's not true camaraderie, but they seem to take some comfort in numbers as they wait. Omar is carrying guilt and feelings of inadequacy as he chose to leave while his older brother Nabil (Kais Nashif) remained in Syria to fight in the war. There is a wonderful "scene" that allows Omar to make peace with their contrasting decisions, and it leads him back to playing music. After all, "a musician who doesn't play is dead". The titular term of Limbo often means stuck, and there is also a game of persistence that uses that name, and both definitions work here. We are reminded that regardless of the various cultures, those in the immigration system have their own personal stories and burdens.

Opens in theaters on April 30, 2021.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":879,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

Day and night, she struggles with her colleagues to support the mothers and their babies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11154574/","name":"Voir le jour","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjBkMDgzNWUtZmFjMy00MTY2LTljMGEtNjkyMzc3ZjAxMjhkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzM3NDI3._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094789/","name":"Sandrine Bonnaire"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0747690/","name":"Brigitte Roüan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004133/","name":"Aure Atika"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0486596/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0624903/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1125358/","name":"Julie Bonnie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0481866/","name":"Marion Laine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8279997/","name":"Laura Piani"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi845725209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg1YTZlZmYtY2ZiYy00ZWFlLThmNTItOWIwZTc5NzVlYWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2020-08-12","description":"Jeanne works in a maternity yard in Marseille. Day and night, she struggles with her colleagues to support the mothers and their babies.","keywords":"mother,midwife,maternity","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11154574/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A nurse's work is never done.","reviewBody":"It could not have come at a better time,this tribute to the staff of a maternity hospital:midwives, nurses, nurses' aides .I could do without Bonnaire's rock singer past and her daughter's clichéed frames of mind ;the gist of the movie , which takes place in the maternity is close to documentary ,and Sandrine Bonnaire is not really the star , all the actresses are admirable: the midwife (Brigitte Rouan ) did not choose this job -she wanted to become a doctor- but her work has become her raison d'être ,in spite of moments of despondency .These underpaid women 's commitment to their work is extraordinary: from the nurses' aide who rocks a crying baby to sleep to Bonnaire who literally saves a baby -and there's won't be any vainglory or legion d'honneur -;one feels the compassion ,the camaraderie ,the solidarity when one of them is held responsible for the death of a baby ,the joie de vivre when ,during a rebellion against the inhuman working conditions (a meager bonus of 20 euros for night work ) , they break into a song "mamy blue" which cheers them up. Even though sometimes they quarrel or meet people at the door shouting against the termination of pregnancy.\n\nThe first sequence sums it up in an admirably succint style: too many patients , shortstaffed nurses and others...","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":99,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6,"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Limbo
Limbo
programme.desc:
Limbo: Directed by Ben Sharrock. With Sidse Babett Knudsen, Kenneth Collard, Amir El-Masry, Vikash Bhai. Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9138170/","name":"Limbo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBiMDJkMzAtMTVhYi00NDFkLTliMTYtYTM4M2I1OGZmNDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461746/","name":"Sidse Babett Knudsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171674/","name":"Kenneth Collard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5011084/","name":"Amir El-Masry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5277246/","name":"Ben Sharrock"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0501662/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316150/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5277246/","name":"Ben Sharrock"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2474754073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q2ODMxMDYtODMzYi00MzIzLWJiMjYtZDVmMTlhZjlhZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request."},"datePublished":"2021-07-30","description":"Omar is a promising young musician. Separated from his Syrian family, he is stuck on a remote Scottish island awaiting the fate of his asylum request.","keywords":"one word title,musician as protagonist,separation from family,musician,scottish island","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9138170/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"it's like a guitar","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Immigration is an important and hot topic these days, and it should be noted that most countries have challenges with people either trying to get in or trying to get out ... and for some, it's both. Writer-director Ben Sharrock offers a unique and creative look at refugees stuck on a nameless remote Scottish island, awaiting word on their UK asylum request.

Omar (Amir El-Masry, Tom Clancy's "Jack Ryan" TV series) has escaped the war in Syria, and we learn much about him from listening in on calls to his mother from the only phone booth on the island. An acclaimed musician in Damascus, Omar lugs around his grandfather's oud ("it's like a guitar"). As proof of his homesickness, the bulky case never leaves his side, nor does he pull the instrument out to play - music is meant for joyous occasions. Omar shares a small house with three other refugees: Farhad (Vikash Bhai) from Afghanistan, Abedi (Kwabena Ansah) from Ghana, and Wasef (Ola Orebiyi) from Nigeria, with the latter two posing as brothers in hopes of improving their odds for asylum.

Omar is a sullen stone-face who absorbs the racist taunts from young locals (they ask if he makes bombs), and stands in contrast to the more outgoing and optimistic (and darn funny) Farhad. Not only does he idolize Freddie Mercury for "teaching" him English, Farhad, with his ever-present cigarette, also captures a chicken and keeps it as a pet. These refugees regularly attend a class entitled "Cultural Awareness 101", meant to acclimate those from varying backgrounds to the local customs and culture. These segments are mined beautifully for comedic effect, while also giving us insight into all those involved. There are also references to Chet Baker, Donnie Osmond, and the TV series, "Friends".

This is a terrific film, as well as an odd one. Many of the shots from cinematographer Nick Cooke are static and sparse in style, and though focused on the individuals, the camera also captures much of the isolation of the island. These visuals are stunning in both their simplicity and relevance. It's a dramedy unafraid to be absurd in a moment, while also being enlightening. At times it has the feel of Wes Anderson without the color palette. We aren't sure what is worse, the weather or the local postal service. Brutal cold envelops the newcomers, while the delivery route of a postal van (and the reactions of the refugees) is a comedic highlight. Even the local market, with its limited spice selection and directions for urination, draws laughter from us.

Despite the comedy, we never lose sight of these folks being stuck in purgatory. Maybe it's not true camaraderie, but they seem to take some comfort in numbers as they wait. Omar is carrying guilt and feelings of inadequacy as he chose to leave while his older brother Nabil (Kais Nashif) remained in Syria to fight in the war. There is a wonderful "scene" that allows Omar to make peace with their contrasting decisions, and it leads him back to playing music. After all, "a musician who doesn't play is dead". The titular term of Limbo often means stuck, and there is also a game of persistence that uses that name, and both definitions work here. We are reminded that regardless of the various cultures, those in the immigration system have their own personal stories and burdens.

Opens in theaters on April 30, 2021.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":879,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Full Monty
Goło i wesoło
programme.desc:
The Full Monty: Directed by Peter Cattaneo. With Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Wim Snape, Steve Huison. Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119164/","name":"The Full Monty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg0NWFjMTAtNGZjMC00NmZlLThhZDYtM2MzNTU2NDZiZDVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119164/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ebe28"},"dateCreated":"1999-11-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Dark Comedy that comes out shining very bright","reviewBody":"When I first saw this movie, I absolutely loved it. With each successive viewing, I noticed the characters' emotions as they coped with the dirty hand that has been dealt to them and making the most of it. I also saw the immense bond between the men as they already shared the low-class existence and a rather bleak future but seeing nothing but an opportunity to be rich. And they were all willing to endure the humiliation in front of hundreds of people to achieve it.

Like M*A*S*H, the Full Monty shows people placed in a harrowing existence with seemingly no end in sight. Yet the laughs are sprinkled throughout nicely, and even though each man has their own personal fears to overcome, they find strength in each other, which makes the experience all the more fruitful.

The actors were absolutely top notch, particularly Robert Carlyle. I was already impressed with his performance from Trainspotting to know that he is very capable of carrying the central figure of the movie. Peter Cattaneo's direction was inspired, and he knew the right angles to use (check out the scene when the lads were auditioning new members, particularly Guy) for perfect comedic effect.

I admit that some of the sub-plots needed more fleshing out, particularly between Gaz and Nathan as well as Gerald and his wife. And as many times as I've seen the movie, I don't know much about Guy other than his love for Singing in the Rain and his obvious natural endowment that took the breath away from his mates!

The music was terrific as well. I dare anyone to deny that they had to consciously stop tapping their feet when hearing "Hot Stuff" after watching this movie.

I have been to Sheffield recently, so the movie holds even more personal meaning for me. And for all those complaining about the accents being difficult to understand, watch it again. It's in English not Chinese! The accents are part of the charm. I rate this movie a solid 8.5 out of 10 and worth seeing many times over.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":102212,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1997-08-29","keywords":"steel worker,unemployment,male stripper,northern england,dole","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Full Monty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi395116825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJhOTk1ZjQtOGQyMC00NzcxLTg1ZTctYjA3ZTllMzA1MmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJhOTk1ZjQtOGQyMC00NzcxLTg1ZTctYjA3ZTllMzA1MmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Fox Searchlight Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001015/","name":"Robert Carlyle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004692/","name":"Mark Addy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146341/","name":"Peter Cattaneo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065001/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064479/","name":"Simon Beaufoy"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

scouts, on the eve of their last camp-out, discover the true meaning of friendship when they attempt to save their town from a zombie outbreak.","keywords":"zombie,bare breasts,boy scout,blonde,voyeurism","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1727776/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"quincytheodore"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Silly nightmare made out of boys' dreams","reviewBody":"Zombie gimmick has become so redundant in recent time, even the mockery of it created another actual subgenre as it has spawned many clones this year alone. Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse is as juvenile as it sounds, some of the jokes are either downright bizarre or blatantly aggressive. Still, its simple theme and full commitment to awkward crudity are surprisingly effective on creating a few laughs.

Story is incredibly straightforward, it's basically written in the title. Three scouts find themselves in a zombie outbreak, and with the help of a hot chick they form some silly version of A-Team. Characters are not original. Maybe the main lead is pretty likable, but most of the characters are absolutely simple minded and comical or stereotypically comical. Its use of friendship tone is decent, it may be the only working drama angle here.

The entire movie is satire made out of cliché and some freaky stuffs way outside the box. Don't bother with logic or continuity, since they are admittedly flawed, at some points the plot seems shaky at best. As for the jokes, they are simply brash. This is definitely a visual clobbering as well as a jab at genre's silliness. Those wanting maturity or deep psychological study will find themselves lost.

It's similar to humor from gag website or forum comment threads, coupled with mandatory bloody gore and obtuse use of breasts and buttocks for viewer's pleasure. Normally this kind of overwhelming sensory overload can be appalling, yet the movie is unapologetically bizarre that the comedy works more than it falters.

This is a juvenile showing in purest form, using primitive jokes, nudity and even random singing. It should not be this entertaining, yet surprisingly it is.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47384,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

formula,bubble","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2279373/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bryanboldt"},"dateCreated":"2015-06-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Expect the Unexpected","reviewBody":"Let me start off by saying, before I saw this movie, based on the trailers, my expectations were as low as they could possibly be. I was expecting this movie to be the nail in the coffin for the Spongebob franchise, and I was legitimately concerned that I would never see a good thing come from the series ever again. Boy was I wrong. Sponge Out of Water is an absolute TREAT for both old and new fans of the series alike, and the movie kept me entertained to the very end. The 2D animation is the best animation I have seen in a LONG time. I found every frame enjoyable, and it almost has a Ren and Stimpy like feel to it which made me appreciate it so much more. (If you ever watch/re-watch this movie, take a good look at the facial animations during the 2D parts, they're absolutely brilliant). Not only this, but the jokes and gags are hilarious, and only occasionally fall short, but when they do, they make sure to make up for it. (Listen for the "my leg!" recurring gag!). Also this movie is sure to leave you wondering "what will happen next?!" As you can never quite predict what the writers will throw out at you (others have compared this movie to an acid trip, and I don't want to spoil anything, but I found it a rather enjoyable one) The only thing I did not like was the "superpowers" part, (this was the part that turned me off in the first place) as I felt some of them tried "too hard" to make the audience laugh, and it just didn't feel like Spongebob. Thankfully this part only lasts about 20 minutes, and moves onto one of the greatest movie endings, tying it up all in a bow with a nice rap battle that came out of nowhere (Creators of Epic Rap Battles of History), and some interpretative dance from Squidward that parodies his famous dance moves from a previous episode. All in all, this movie would have been a 10/10 if Spongebob stayed anchored, and never had left the water. The live action visuals were impressive, but during those scenes, the comedy hit a dry spell until the last moments of the movie. If you're a long time fan of Spongebob, this is a great movie to relive your childhood a little bit more. (Hopefully the new season of the TV show will be just as good!) Go see this movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50788,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

the Unexpected","reviewBody":"Let me start off by saying, before I saw this movie, based on the trailers, my expectations were as low as they could possibly be. I was expecting this movie to be the nail in the coffin for the Spongebob franchise, and I was legitimately concerned that I would never see a good thing come from the series ever again. Boy was I wrong. Sponge Out of Water is an absolute TREAT for both old and new fans of the series alike, and the movie kept me entertained to the very end. The 2D animation is the best animation I have seen in a LONG time. I found every frame enjoyable, and it almost has a Ren and Stimpy like feel to it which made me appreciate it so much more. (If you ever watch/re-watch this movie, take a good look at the facial animations during the 2D parts, they're absolutely brilliant). Not only this, but the jokes and gags are hilarious, and only occasionally fall short, but when they do, they make sure to make up for it. (Listen for the "my leg!" recurring gag!). Also this movie is sure to leave you wondering "what will happen next?!" As you can never quite predict what the writers will throw out at you (others have compared this movie to an acid trip, and I don't want to spoil anything, but I found it a rather enjoyable one) The only thing I did not like was the "superpowers" part, (this was the part that turned me off in the first place) as I felt some of them tried "too hard" to make the audience laugh, and it just didn't feel like Spongebob. Thankfully this part only lasts about 20 minutes, and moves onto one of the greatest movie endings, tying it up all in a bow with a nice rap battle that came out of nowhere (Creators of Epic Rap Battles of History), and some interpretative dance from Squidward that parodies his famous dance moves from a previous episode. All in all, this movie would have been a 10/10 if Spongebob stayed anchored, and never had left the water. programme.title: The Full Monty
Goło i wesoło
programme.desc:
The Full Monty: Directed by Peter Cattaneo. With Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Wim Snape, Steve Huison. Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119164/","name":"The Full Monty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODg0NWFjMTAtNGZjMC00NmZlLThhZDYtM2MzNTU2NDZiZDVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119164/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ebe28"},"dateCreated":"1999-11-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Dark Comedy that comes out shining very bright","reviewBody":"When I first saw this movie, I absolutely loved it. With each successive viewing, I noticed the characters' emotions as they coped with the dirty hand that has been dealt to them and making the most of it. I also saw the immense bond between the men as they already shared the low-class existence and a rather bleak future but seeing nothing but an opportunity to be rich. And they were all willing to endure the humiliation in front of hundreds of people to achieve it.

Like M*A*S*H, the Full Monty shows people placed in a harrowing existence with seemingly no end in sight. Yet the laughs are sprinkled throughout nicely, and even though each man has their own personal fears to overcome, they find strength in each other, which makes the experience all the more fruitful.

The actors were absolutely top notch, particularly Robert Carlyle. I was already impressed with his performance from Trainspotting to know that he is very capable of carrying the central figure of the movie. Peter Cattaneo's direction was inspired, and he knew the right angles to use (check out the scene when the lads were auditioning new members, particularly Guy) for perfect comedic effect.

I admit that some of the sub-plots needed more fleshing out, particularly between Gaz and Nathan as well as Gerald and his wife. And as many times as I've seen the movie, I don't know much about Guy other than his love for Singing in the Rain and his obvious natural endowment that took the breath away from his mates!

The music was terrific as well. I dare anyone to deny that they had to consciously stop tapping their feet when hearing "Hot Stuff" after watching this movie.

I have been to Sheffield recently, so the movie holds even more personal meaning for me. And for all those complaining about the accents being difficult to understand, watch it again. It's in English not Chinese! The accents are part of the charm. I rate this movie a solid 8.5 out of 10 and worth seeing many times over.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":102212,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1997-08-29","keywords":"steel worker,unemployment,male stripper,northern england,dole","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Full Monty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi395116825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJhOTk1ZjQtOGQyMC00NzcxLTg1ZTctYjA3ZTllMzA1MmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJhOTk1ZjQtOGQyMC00NzcxLTg1ZTctYjA3ZTllMzA1MmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Fox Searchlight Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001015/","name":"Robert Carlyle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004692/","name":"Mark Addy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146341/","name":"Peter Cattaneo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065001/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064479/","name":"Simon Beaufoy"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

As a result, it is factually correct but loses some of the book's deeper qualities. Artistically well done, especially with the flawless major roles. Some of the minor characters didn't correspond well with the expected behavior of the generation. 

The team consists of local superstars and this could be a bit too much for locals, but not a problem to foreigners. So, if you wish to see a historically correct representation of year 1939 in Latvia in the eyes of an 8 years old girl from a poor and troubled family (although intelligent and loving in its own way) who later turns out to be one of the brightest stars in Latvian literature and a shortlisted Nobel candidate of several years - go ahead.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":668,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="
